decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Goryo's Vengeance to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand into play from the graveyard, using instant spells like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to reanimate them quickly. Quantum Riddler and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide additional synergies with reanimation and instant spells. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, as well as removal in Fatal Push and Solitude. The deck aims to combo off and win the game quickly by bringing back powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into powerful threats such as Ugin, Karn, and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like All Is Dust and Relic of Progenitus, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down artifact-based strategies. The deck also has a strong late-game plan with cards like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Devourer of Destiny to close out the game. The focus is on efficient mana ramp and powerful threats to dominate the board.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a low-cost artifact creatures and maximizing their power with artifact synergy cards such as Mox Opal and Urza's Saga. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle while using cards like Thoughtcast and Thought Monitor to maintain card advantage. By leveraging the strong synergy between artifacts and creatures, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful combos and synergies without relying on traditional land cards. It focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Bloom and Hydroelectric Specimen, while controlling the game with disruption spells like Disrupting Shoal and Suppression Ray. The deck aims to win the game with cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer, using cards like Step Through and Whir of Invention to find key pieces. Additionally, it utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Lady Octopus, Inspired Inventor to further its game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using cheap artifacts to enable powerful synergies. Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Thoughtcast provide additional value. Urza's Saga is a key land that can help ramp up quickly and search for important artifacts like Cranial Plating. The aim is to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and efficient artifact-based spells, utilizing the aggressive nature of the Affinity archetype to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Guide of Souls to quickly pressure the opponent and deal damage efficiently. It also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Seasoned Pyromancer to control the board and support the aggro strategy. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and buff for the creatures. With a mix of creature aggression, burn spells, and disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison, the Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It uses a combination of discard spells like Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push, and disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp to control the board. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk to close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support both black and white spells, allowing for flexibility in casting the deck's powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using cards like Whir of Invention, Lotus Bloom, and Goblin Charbelcher without relying on traditional lands. This allows for a more streamlined and explosive strategy that can catch opponents off guard. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces and control the game tempo. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently execute its game plan and overwhelm the opponent with its unique combo strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing various self-mill and discard effects to fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, players can quickly assemble a critical mass of cards in the graveyard, allowing them to efficiently reanimate these creatures with spells like Unearth and Persist. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce to help protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board, while creatures like Solitude and Quantum Riddler provide threats that can end the game quickly. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to maximize value from enters-the-battlefield abilities. By combining disruptive elements with a streamlined aggro strategy, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through a coordinated assault.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Urza's Saga allows for powerful artifact tutoring, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast provide card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing both aggressive creatures and burn spells to control the board and close out games quickly.

This deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending to combo off and overwhelm the opponent. It also uses instant speed interaction like Solitude and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. The deck also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Psychic Frog to generate card advantage and dig for key pieces. By efficiently reanimating threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck looks to win the game in a explosive manner.

The core strategy of this UW Control deck revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and eventually stabilize with powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The inclusion of a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional value and flexibility in deck building. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient control elements and strategic decision-making.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by cheap combat tricks and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also focuses on card advantage through cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble, allowing the player to maintain pressure while digging for more threats and answers. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistency in mana sources and smooth gameplay.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick creature plays and direct damage to overwhelm opponents. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, the deck aims to win early and decisively. Cards like Goblin Bombardment and Showdown of the Skalds provide additional reach and impact, while the inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah offer high-powered finishers. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan, ensuring consistent performance in fast-paced matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a landless combo strategy focused on quickly assembling key pieces and disrupting the opponent's plans. By using cards like Whir of Invention and Lotus Bloom to ramp up mana and then deploying powerful cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control elements. The inclusion of counterspells and disruptive spells like Jwari Disruption and Suppression Ray further solidify the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's plans while maintaining its own strategy.
